definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Today, he demanded to see its birth certificate." –David Letterman
sentences.chinese: 今天，他要求验看一下婴儿的出生证明”。

sentences.english: He falsified his birth certificate to get a passport.
sentences.chinese: 为了取得护照，他伪造了出生证明。

sentences.english: Birther lie was the most hurtful one.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马总统的出生证明事件是最令人震惊的。

sentences.english: That's more phony that 0bama's birth certificate.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的出生证明有更多的假货。

sentences.english: His birth certificate shows that he is Barack Obama's half-brother.
sentences.chinese: 他的出生证明显示他是总统奥巴马的同父兄弟。

sentences.english: Your birth certificate is an apology letter from the condom factory.
sentences.chinese: 你的出生证明，是杜蕾斯寄给你父母的一封道歉信。

sentences.english: A birth certificate is also important for another reason.
sentences.chinese: 由于另一个原因，使出生证明变得很重要。

definition: to apply for residence/to register a birth
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
